question: Can I afford a mortgage for a $300,000 house with an annual income of $75,000?
true_answer: Yes, with an income of $75,000, assuming standard debts and a 20% down payment, you can afford a $300,000 house.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage for a $300,000 house with an annual income of $75,000?

Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for affordability criteria. 2) Involve credit_agent to discuss credit impacts. 3) Use calculator for DTI and mortgage estimation. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability criteria.
Affordability typically requires a DTI below 36% and a down payment of at least 20%.
Considering a mortgage can impact credit utilization and score; ensure credit score is healthy.
Calculating estimated monthly payment and DTI with $75,000 income and standard debts.
Estimated monthly payment is $1,430. DTI calculated as 32%.
What if I make a lower down payment?
Retrieving impact of lower down payment on mortgage affordability.
Lower down payment increases loan principal and monthly payments, may affect interest rates.
Review complete, all criteria checked successfully.
Yes, with an income of $75,000 and assuming standard debts and a 20% down payment, you can afford a $300,000 house.
Thanks! Can you also tell me about the interest rates I might expect?
Retrieving current interest rates for 30-year fixed mortgages.
